SAN FRANCISCO -- Mets manager Terry Collins said he was n't surprised to see his team win . Todd Frazier hit a sacrifice fly in the 11th inning to lift the Mets to a 2 - 1 victory over the San Francisco Giants on Wednesday night . The Mets won for the fourth time in five games and improved to a season-high 10 games over .500 . The Giants lost for the fourth time in five games . Wilmer Flores led off the 11th with a double against Hunter Strickland ( 3 - 4 ) , advanced on Jay Bruce 's groundout and scored on Frazier 's fly ball to deep center . Jerry Blevins ( 2 - 2 ) pitched a scoreless 10th for the win . Jerry Blevins ( 2 - 2 ) pitched the 10th for the win . Jerry Blevins ( 2 - 2 ) pitched the 10th for the win . Seth Lugo pitched two scoreless innings and Seth Lugo pitched the ninth to complete the three - hitter . Todd Frazier hit a sacrifice fly in the first and Todd Frazier had a sacrifice fly in the fourth for the Mets , who have lost seven of eight . The Mets had runners on first and second with one out in the fourth , but Michael Conforto grounded out to end the inning . The Giants tied it in the fifth when Brandon Nimmo drew a one - out walk , stole second and scored on Tomas Nido 's double . The Mets had runners on second and third with two outs in the sixth , but Mark Melancon struck out Todd Frazier to end the inning . The Giants tied it in the bottom of the inning when Brandon Nimmo drew a one - out walk , stole second and scored on Tomas Nido 's double . The Giants had runners on first and second with one out in the seventh , but Mark Melancon struck out Todd Frazier to end the inning .
